originalText.text: This place is more than amazing!! Ive been coming here for years. Whether I take the train or not since it is close ti E train. Matter of fact, got a bag ready for drop off. See you soon!!

originalText.text: The workers here really care and pay attention to detail. Will be bringing my shoes here for cleaning and repair. I lucky enough to have them even clean my basketball shoes I accidentally wore to work in the kitchen. They look like new after a little TLC in the shop

originalText.text:
They were very professional and friendly and repaired a tear in my bookbag for $15. I highly recommend their services. When I couldn't find them, I gave them a call and the gentlemen gave me clear directions.

Please note that for me it was somewhat difficult to find them. They are located in the train station, you have to use your metrocard to get to them.

Please note that for me it was somewhat difficult to find them. They are located in the train station, you have to use your metrocard to get to them.

originalText.text: I came in here after I was told another shoe repair was closed on 42nd. They were able to fix the heels of two pair of boots for $15 a pair and they did it within two hours. Perfect for Halloween! They did offer to fix the soles of a pair for $30 but I said no as I just needed the heels fixed momentarily. They also painted the bottom of my shoes to appear cleaner which I appreciated. Since I always come in from port Authority to ride to subway, I will return when I have more time with other shoes. PS they’re Latino run which I love!

originalText.text:
Two weeks ago I visited this shop to replace worn shoe laces on my dress shoes. Unfortunately, one of the laces ripped while being tied. Which is okay, things happen.

However, the shop owner's response when I brought this issue to him was completely unprofessional. I asked if he could replace the laces, and he said "that's not my problem, complain to the [lace] company, not me. What do you want me to do? That will be four dollars."

Although the lace breaking was not his fault, it was a product being sold in his store and should have been amenable to discussing the issue further instead of having such a cavalier attitude about the situation.

I'm not angry -- the laces were cheap, however, I AM disappointed in the shop owner's inability to remain professional and practice good business etiquette.

I would give less stars if possible.
